message_1: Consider the conformal map $f(z) = \frac{1}{z}$ which maps the unit disk $\{z \in \mathbb{C}: |z|<1\}$ onto the exterior of the unit circle $\{z \in \mathbb{C}: |z|>1\}$. Find the image of the point $z=i/2$ under this map.
message_2:
To find the image of the point $z = i/2$ under the conformal map $f(z) = \frac{1}{z}$, we simply need to evaluate $f(i/2)$.

$f\left(\frac{i}{2}\right) = \frac{1}{\frac{i}{2}} = \frac{1}{i/2} \cdot \frac{2}{2} = \frac{2}{i}$

Now, we can multiply the numerator and denominator by the complex conjugate of the denominator to get the result in the standard form of a complex number:

$\frac{2}{i} \cdot \frac{-i}{-i} = \frac{-2i}{1} = -2i$

So, the image of the point $z = i/2$ under the conformal map $f(z) = \frac{1}{z}$ is $-2i$.
